summary: bran: *loved to climb and was very good at it* *very likeable* *kind and sweet towards others* *dealt with his disability on his...
body:
bran: *loved to climb and was very good at it* *very likeable* *kind and sweet towards others* *dealt with his disability on his own as best as he could in an ableist world* *became lord of winterfell suddenly and handled himself very well* *has amazing powers like warging into animals and seeing visions* *wanted to fight and protect his family* *watched people he knew all his life die* *gave up winterfell to save the people inside* *traveled beyond the wall with two people he just met* *met the three eyed raven and began training* *possible ate one of his friends* *became the 3er* *saw humanity at its worse but still wanted to save it* *tricked the night king* *will defeat the others in the books*

blog.name: bardofavalon
blog.title: Bard of [Av]al[on]
blog.description:
Born 1992. He/Him. Main blog.

The world needs to change for the better. To inspire and be inspired and never forget the good inside of us and always resist hurting ourselves and/or each other.

summary: Do you think everyone will find out Arya killed the knight king. Like bran tells everyone because I doubt Arya will
question: Do you think everyone will find out Arya killed the knight king. Like bran tells everyone because I doubt Arya will
answer: yes, definitely! my bb better get the recognition she deserves! there’s also the theory (or did the writers confirm it?) that jon already knows - that he faced viserion/certain death so arya could slip past the dragon and into the godswood - that at one point he saw her, knew what she was on her way to do and was yelling ‘go,’ not just yelling… and if that’s the case, he’s going to make sure everyone knows it was his little sister who brought about the dawn. bran will too tho, if not. stark men stan their wolf blood sisters. it is known.

summary: This would really annoy me because I hate it when D&D do things off-screen for shock value, but what if Bran told Tyrion about...
question: This would really annoy me because I hate it when D&D do things off-screen for shock value, but what if Bran told Tyrion about Jon... because presumably Bran told Tyrion SOMETHING, right? Why show them starting to have a conversation, and then cut it off? Ugh, this is like Sansa asking Jon if he loved D/ny all over again... obviously something was said. The characters didn't just leave the room. We're just being cut off from their POV.
answer:
This does not annoy me, I have to admit. If they want to keep the audience engaged, the audience still needs to see things that make them ask questions. What was that about? What will that lead to? What will happen? If they tell us everything that will happen there’s no suspense and there’s no point in watching. (And this is why plans made on screen fail, like, 95% of the time.)

Anyway…

Bran has been watching Tyrion a lot. I suppose Tyrion could’ve just been curious about Bran and his powers and wanted to know more. He might not be getting any employee of the month awards any time soon, but he’s had to have noticed that Sansa doesn’t like Dny and that Jon’s suddenly avoiding her. And here’s this weird deadpan kid who ~knows stuff~. Knowing stuff is Tyrion’s thing! Perhaps all Tyrion was doing was getting to know the enemy. And perhaps Bran took the opportunity to nudge a bit because divided loyalties and all.

There’s this other thing I’m interested in too that’s sort of related.

After Jaime’s trial, Jaime finds Bran in the godswood and they have a little chat.

J: Why didn’t you tell them [about pushing him out the window]?
B: You won’t be able to help us in this fight if I let them murder you first.
J: What about afterwards?
B: How do you know there is an afterwards?

So………………. What kind of crucial help did Jaime give them? Did he do anything that was super important? I suppose he knighted Brienne and he later saved her, right? But other than that? This is a genuine question; I can’t remember Jaime doing anything crucial. Did he save Arya? That would’ve made sense. Does anyone remember?

But let’s say he didn’t, just for speculating’s sake.

While Jaime definitely talks about the war against the Night King and his “afterwards” refers to what happens after they’ve won that particular battle–and it’s clearly what we’re supposed to think the conversation is about–why does it have to be what Bran is talking about?

Could Bran have meant another fight? The fight against Dny and/or Cersei. The fight the Starks will inevitably find themselves in post aotd victory. And, while Jaime did survive the battle against the aotd and did get that afterwards he talked about, what if he doesn’t survive the next one? Perhaps that’s the “afterwards” to which Bran was referring and implying Jaime might not live to see.

Perhaps Bran is nudging both Lannister men in certain directions to make sure the Starks endure.

In his talk with Jaime, Bran points out he pushed him out the window to protect his family. The things we do for love. And while Bran might not be much Bran anymore, he still seems to be loyal to his family. He still seems to care about his family, in his own way. So why wouldn’t he protect them if he can? I doubt he can do anything big to change the timeline, but perhaps he can make little ripples here and there to make sure everything stays on course.

Thanks for the ask!

blog.name: mother-of-the-fandom
blog.title: Isaac Hempstead Wright
blog.description: Like a woman about to go forth in SIN -  this blog does contain NSFW posts

summary: R u friends with Isaac or something?
question: R u friends with Isaac or something?
answer:
Eh lmao no I wouldn’t say friends but he knows who I am. I talked to him once during a live periscope thing he did and he recognized me from Twitter and he replied once to me on Twitter and I have several pictures that he signed and mailed back to me. I don’t really count that bc he signed a lot of fan mail at one point tho. 

I was being really sarcastic when I posted this and he replied all serious lmao

I also have these custom Coke bottles I ordered. I had to submit his name and the Bran Stark name bc they didn’t exist before this and unless anyone else has ordered these, I think I’m the only one with them.

Oh he does have in his possession some fanart I drew of Eggs from the Boxtrolls. I discovered it one day when he took a picture of his new piano at home and in the reflection of the piano lid you could see a collection of items he had on a windowsill in the background, and my picture was amongst them, so that was like, one of the best days of my life. You can see the little arrow pointing to my art!

The autographed pics are in my gram here [X]

Sorry for going on but all this stuff just makes me insanely happy.

summary: I was expecting so much more than this.  With all the mystery and fear and horror surrounding the Night King, I was expecting...
body:
Game of Thrones Season 8: The Death of the Night King

I was expecting so much more than this. With all the mystery and fear and horror surrounding the Night King, I was expecting that there would have been an epic confrontation with him and the key heroes of GoT, specifically Bran and Jon. Bran, because he’s the Three-Eyed Raven and one of those still in touch with the ancient magic that led to the creation of the Night King. Jon, because to me, there has to be more to his being the son of two ancient Houses than just the unification of the Seven Kingdoms. I don’t mind if Arya still ends up dealing the killing blow. She’s still a Stark and the blood of the First Men runs in her veins. But only after the confrontation. In fact, it would have been great if the Night King and the remaining Starks - all of them: Jon, Bran, Sansa and Arya - were part of that final confrontation before his destruction. And the Night King should have at least said something. Not just act all scary and angry. I mean, I want him to tell the Starks why he’s so angry and why he wants to destroy the world that they know of.

With all the buildup surrounding his character and his army of the undead, I just find the treatment of the Night King’s death underwhelming.

reblog.comment:
Game of Thrones Season 8: The Death of the Night King

I was expecting so much more than this. With all the mystery and fear and horror surrounding the Night King, I was expecting that there would have been an epic confrontation with him and the key heroes of GoT, specifically Bran and Jon. Bran, because he’s the Three-Eyed Raven and one of those still in touch with the ancient magic that led to the creation of the Night King. Jon, because to me, there has to be more to his being the son of two ancient Houses than just the unification of the Seven Kingdoms. I don’t mind if Arya still ends up dealing the killing blow. She’s still a Stark and the blood of the First Men runs in her veins. But only after the confrontation. In fact, it would have been great if the Night King and the remaining Starks - all of them: Jon, Bran, Sansa and Arya - were part of that final confrontation before his destruction. And the Night King should have at least said something. Not just act all scary and angry. I mean, I want him to tell the Starks why he’s so angry and why he wants to destroy the world that they know of.

With all the buildup surrounding his character and his army of the undead, I just find the treatment of the Night King’s death underwhelming.

She’s still a Stark and the blood of the First Men runs in her veins. But only after the confrontation. In fact, it would have been great if the Night King and the remaining Starks - all of them: Jon, Bran, Sansa and Arya - were part of that final confrontation before his destruction. I mean, I want him to tell the Starks why he’s so angry and why he wants to destroy the world that they know of.

With all the buildup surrounding his character and his army of the undead, I just find the treatment of the Night King’s death underwhelming.

summary: This is my favorite character in "Game of Thrones" - Bran Stark. He charmed me at first sight, thanks for actor's playing. Two...
caption:
This is my favorite character in “Game of Thrones” - Bran Stark. He charmed me at first sight, thanks for actor’s playing.
Two weeks ago I started to watch this serial. And ofcourse I'am waiting the final episodes. I hope that Bran will survive all life challenges…..or I will cry in despair :“D

blog.name: sansastarkisbetterthanyourfaves
blog.title: Sansa Stark is better than your faves
blog.description: Lori, (late) 20s, She/Her, Walking Talking Bi Girl Stereotype, Social Justice Druid, Stucky, Drarry, ASOIAF. Also Horses. And I feel like I should warn you I sometimes write poetry... and fic.

tags: Although fair play to maisie she obviously negotiated her contract well
summary: All the Starks have different strengths: If you want someone killed, call Arya. If you want someone to rebuild the North and...
body:
All the Starks have different strengths:

If you want someone killed, call Arya.

If you want someone to rebuild the North and bind the people together in the face of adversity, you’ve got Sansa.

If you want a creepy psychic to freak people out, there’s Bran.

If you need someone to stand around and brood or to scream in the face of an undead dragon, you can have Jon.

None of them could have survived the journey that the others have been on, and none of them have the same skill set. That’s kind of the point.

The lone wolf dies, but the pack survives.
